WRITING.TEXT: Seems like a changeling film, not uncommon in old Irish folklore.

WRITING.TITLE: In honor of Romero, the first piece to my horror sleeve. Pittsburgh, PA/Justin at Pittsburgh Tattoo Company

WRITING.TEXT: I already have visible tats on my arms and a larger one one my back amp; work in the restaurant amp; craft beer industry, been working for breweries over the last few years in sales and marketing/bartending and it's honestly the norm #129335; #127997; #8205; #9792; #65039; I decided to go for the hand because I've got a few I can see unless looking in the mirror or taking a pic amp; I loved this design so much I wanted to see it every day + I typically love to wear a ton of rings on my hands and I love the combination of the 2.
Not too bad, obviously wasn't the best feeling but it only really hurt like a bitch around my knuckles, that was less fun..

WRITING.TITLE: Next Up: Creepshow! Apparently couldn't resist another Romero one but tossed in a little Stephen King this time #129321; Pittsburgh, PA - done by Justin Sims @ Pittsburgh Tattoo Company

Next up: Creepshow! Apparently couldn't resist another Romero piece but we invited Mr. King to the party this time - Pittsburgh, PA / Done again by the awesome Justin Sims at Pittsburgh Tattoo Company

WRITING.TEXT: I've heard great things about Susie as well, though I've never gotten anything from her, and seen her work - she's also fabulous! Love Justin's work, we're planning a whole sleeve together and stylistically we just work together so wonderfully, not to mention he's cool as hell and is also a big horror film fan :)

WRITING.TITLE: Far side of our Pittsburgh, PA living room looking onto studio space amp; iron staircase leading up to roof #128525;
